content: f213 retro cardo scarf by lisa r myers all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free for questions or support please email info@fairmountfibers com 11/11/24 © fairmount fibers ltd 2024 not to be reproduced or re-knit for profit page 1 of 3 f213 size instructions 76 x 6½ granny square round 1 with mc ch4 join with slip_stitch into first chain ch3 2dc into materials ring ch2 3dc into ring 3 times ch2 join with slip_stitch into top manos del uruguay cardo 100% corriedale wool approx of ch3 fasten_off and cut yarn 109 yds/100g 1 skein each of 4 colors round 2 see note below about color placement join first cc shown in d2300 bottle mc d2295 gecko cc1 d2020 in a ch2 space ch3 2dc into same ch2 space ch2 3dc into same spirulina cc2 and d2221 goldenrod cc3 ch2 space ch1 3dc into next ch2 space ch2 3dc into same ch2 space 3 times ch1 join with slip_stitch into top of ch3 fasten_off us k/6 5mm hook or size to obtain gauge and cut yarn tapestry needle round 3 join next cc in a ch2 space ch3 2dc into same ch2 space gauge ch2 3dc into same ch2 space ch1 3dc into next ch1 space ch1 1 square = 6 x 6 3dc ch2 3dc into ch2 space 3 times ch1 join with slip_stitch into top of ch3 fasten_off and cut yarn abbreviations chain chain round 4 join last cc in a ch2 space ch3 2dc into same ch2 space ch2 double_crochet double_crochet 3dc into same ch2 space ch1 3dc into next ch1 space twice ch1 round round 3dc ch2 3dc into ch2 space 3 times ch1 join with slip_stitch into single_crochet single_crochet top of ch3 sl slip st stitch all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free for questions or support please email info@fairmountfibers com 11/11/24 © fairmount fibers ltd 2024 not to be reproduced or re-knit for profit page 2 of 3 f213 color placement using mc and placing the squares in random order join make 12 squares all using mc for round 1 and two each of by overlapping the edges of two squares and working slip_stitch the following combinations through the back loops of the last round round 2 cc1 round 3 cc2 round 4 cc3 when all squares have been joined single_crochet around scarf with mc round 2 cc1 round 3 cc3 round 4 cc2 making one stitch in each edge stitch and 4 stitches in each of round 2 cc2 round 3 cc1 round 4 cc2 the 4 corner ch2 spaces round 2 cc2 round 3 cc2 round 4 cc1 round 2 cc3 round 3 cc1 round 4 cc2 weave in ends block scarf if you didn t block the individual round 2 cc3 round 3 cc2 round 4 cc1 squares finishing block squares to finished measurements if necessary all efforts were made to make this pattern error-free for questions or support please email info@fairmountfibers com 11/11/24 © fairmount fibers
